title: The Pitt: Noah Wyle's Intense ER-Style Medical Drama Is Already Renewed for Season 2
shortdescription: Real-time hospital chaos is back – and critics say it's the best medical show in decades.
author: TV Insider

content.content: /images/The Pitt Noah Wyle's Intense ER-Style Medical.webp
One Shift. Real Time. Total Chaos.

Noah Wyle is back in scrubs — and The Pitt just became Max’s fastest-renewed show ever. The intense medical drama, filmed in real-time over a single 15-hour ER shift, was picked up for Season 2 just three days after premiere.
Wyle plays Dr. Robby Fontana, a jaded chief resident leading a team through mass casualties, ethical nightmares, and personal meltdowns — all without a single cutaway.
The New King of Medical Dramas
With a 98% on Rotten Tomatoes, critics are calling it “ER on steroids” and “the most realistic hospital show ever made.” Viewers report actual heart palpitations.
